parser

Class ConfigurationSection

  • java.lang.Object
    • parser.ConfigurationSection
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CardParser, DefaultConfigurationSection, IOMParser, LagConfigurationParser, LagParser, MDAParser, PortConfigurationParser, PortParser, SystemParser, SystemPersistenceParser, SystemSNMPParser

    public abstract class ConfigurationSection
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for moding a configuration section. This implements the Section interface The class is used to handle and parse all configuration lines. There should be a specific extenstion of this class when parsing configuration files. The state machine should keep trace of the current context and/or mode of the configuration and call the appropriate sub ConfigurationSection sub-class to handle a given configuration command.
    Author:
    Kris Peterson

      • ConfigurationSection

        public ConfigurationSection(java.lang.String configSectionName,
                    SRChassisObject routerObject,
                    ContextChange contextChangeHandler)
        Parameters:
        configSectionName - Custom string for the configuration section. Each subclass should be unique
        routerObject - RouterObject that will be populated by the parser
        contextChangeHandler - Notifier for context changes.

    • Method Detail

      • Parse

        public void Parse(java.lang.String line)
        Parse the configuration line. The lines should be handed to this method one at a time. The commandHash will be searched for a match. If a match is found int eh commandHash, the appriate handler from CommandHandler.getMethodName() will be called to handle the configuration line
        Parameters:
        line - Single line from the configuration file

        public java.lang.String getCurrentLine()

        public void setParent(ConfigurationSection section)
        Set the parent configuration section/mode.
        Parameters:
        section - Section that is the parent for the current context/mode.

      • getParent

        public ConfigurationSection getParent()
        REturns the parent configuration section
        Returns:
        ConfigurationSection object of the parent. Null if it is a top level context/mode.

      • getLastCommandDepth

        public int getLastCommandDepth()
        Returns:
        Returns the depth of the last/current command passed to the Parse command.

      • getSectionDepth

        public int getSectionDepth()
        Returns:
        Returns the start depth of the section - the depth of the command that changed the context to the current section.

      • setSectionDepth

        public void setSectionDepth(int depth)
        Sets the depth for the section
        Parameters:
        depth - Depth of the current section. Number of spaces

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        Name of the configuration section

      • defaultExitHandler

        public void defaultExitHandler(java.util.regex.Matcher matcher)
        Default handler for exiting a section. The depth is checked to make sure the exit command was at the same depth as the entrance depth to the context/section. If it is the same, then change then notify the ParserManager of the change through the contextChangeCallback.
        Parameters:
        matcher - The Match statement from the regex that was used to match the command.

      • exitSection

        public abstract void exitSection(java.util.regex.Matcher matcher)

        public ContextChange getContextNotifier()
